summary: I want to adopt a sentret, but im making sure i have enough info before i do. any sentret/furret care tips?
question: I want to adopt a sentret, but im making sure i have enough info before i do. any sentret/furret care tips?
answer:
Sentrets are omnivorous, while furrets are obligate carnivores. In the wild, sentrets eat insects, small mammals, birds, and reptiles, plants, eggs, and fungi, mostly preferring whichever is easiest to find; furrets predominantly eat meat, supplemented by the other staples of sentret diet. This does mean that commercial sentret food and furret food are not interchangeable; a sentret can subsist on furret food and vice versa, but it’s not healthy in the long term.

Wild sentret mobs are known for their system of keeping watch for predators, in which there’s always at least one sentret awake to alert the mob if a threat should arise. When sentrets are caught, adopted, or otherwise removed from their mobs, the lack of a lookout often leads to high levels of anxiety. A very anxious sentret will not sleep, will eat very little, and may become ill. For this reason, it’s recommended that you allow your sentret to sleep in the same room as either your other pokémon or you, and that you provide it with plenty of potential hiding spaces both in its room and around the house. These hiding spaces will be used frequently, as sentrets are very timid and their flight instincts are easily activated. If your sentret is spooked, leave it alone; leave out a treat such as a berry or bug, but otherwise don’t press it to come out until it’s ready. Furrets don’t use the hiding spaces as much, but they do burrow, so you may find certain hiding spots repurposed into tunnel entrances. If you’d rather avoid that, encourage your furret to only burrow outside. Both sentrets and furrets get cold easily, so you’ll probably also want to place blankets around the house and in your sentret’s sleeping area for it to nestle into.

While sentrets are usually timid and cautious, many furrets are almost the opposite: bold, curious, and exploratory. If not provided with toys, exercise, or other stimulation, furrets will steal items from around the house to play with. There’s a wide variety of furret toys on the market, so that should be easy enough to provide. Both sentrets and furrets need social interaction, the former more so than the latter; make sure to spend plenty of time with your sentret, and let it interact with other pokémon. It may feel unsafe around predators (or any pokémon larger than itself), so be careful when introducing them.

It’s usually a good idea to bathe your sentret or furret once a month, as they tend to build up a musky odour. Fill a sink or bathtub with a few inches of warm water (not too hot or cold) and get your sentret wet, making sure to keep a hand on or under it, as bathing (like many things) will make a sentret anxious. Once it’s wet, lather its body with sentret line shampoo; the line has very sensitive skin, so using another species’s shampoo can cause irritation, but baby shampoo is an acceptable short-term substitute (though not recommended in the long run). Don’t use shampoo near the eyes, ears, nose, or mouth. Rinse your sentret’s body down, then use a soft, wet cloth to gently clean the head and face. Finally, dry it off with a soft towel; it will probably also want to roll on the floor and run around to get fully dry. While you shouldn’t bathe your sentret or furret more than once a month, it’s a good idea to brush it with a soft brush every week to remove dead hairs.

Best of luck!

blog.name: pokemon-plush-rescue
blog.title: Pokemon Plushie Rescue
blog.description: Over the years I've rescued a lot of Pokemon plushies from thrift stores and yard sales, and I put this blog together to catalog my different Pokemon rescues, as well as the other Pokemon plushies that have come into my life that never cease to make me smile. With the success of Dr. Sword's recovery post on my main blog, I'd figure this would also be an interesting place to have

summary: This here is Picasso the Squirtle! I’ve had him for a couple years now, and I got him from a comic book show I went to with my...
caption: This here is Picasso the Squirtle! I’ve had him for a couple years now, and I got him from a comic book show I went to with my dad, so this boi is also in the not exactly a rescue category. He’s from the Pokemon Canvas plush collection, which had a tag that looked like a museum art piece in a way, so I named him Picasso. He’s very smol, has a hard time standing by himself, but he’s such a sweet little dude and is a great part of my Pokefamily

summary: So Sam, do you like any unpopular Pokemon (e . g Bidoof, Luvdisc, POPPLIO)
question: So Sam, do you like any unpopular Pokemon (e . g Bidoof, Luvdisc, POPPLIO)
answer: Bidoof and Popplio gave us some great memes, and I actually made Dakota a Luvdisc plushy for Valentine’s Day! I don’t think she noticed, but she still liked it.

Zossie: But why ;m; They’re so fragile and delicate to stuff like that

summary: Is there a DiamondShipping discord? Because there should be. I know it’s an old ship but for some reason it literally occurred...
body:
Is there a DiamondShipping discord? Because there should be. I know it’s an old ship but for some reason it literally occurred to me a few weeks ago to look for Pokémon fanfiction.

And of course, some of my ships are rare pairs because I cannot escape this hell.

reblog.comment:
